results.title: If these were your children. Part 1
results.brief_description: Focuses on the behaviour of young children to help interpret early clues to possible emotional problems. Depicts the activities and behaviour of a group of second-grade children with their teacher during an ordinary school day. Includes conversations between the teacher and parents which illustrate the influence of the home.

results.title: If these walls could talk 2
results.creator_credit: Mary Kane, Home Box Office, Martha Coolidge, Anne Hech and Jane Anderson
results.brief_description: If These Walls Could Talk 2 is 3 short stories over 3 separate decades involving lesbian couples. The first story 1961 features Vanessa Redgrave in an Emmy award winning performance playing Edith whose partner has died after a stroke and has to inhere her partners Nephew wanting to sell up her home not ever realising that his Aunt and Edith were in a relationship for over 30 years. 1972 is about Linda (Michelle Williams) who meets and can’t resist Amy another young lesbian who takes on a very masculine appearance much to the ridicule of Linda’s fellow housemates who see themselves as a group of passionate feminists. Finally 2000 which features Sharon Stone and Ellen Degeneres as a loving committed couple who want to have a baby. Some of the issues they must cope with are do they get a friend to help them, do they go to a sperm bank or should they try the treatment at home.

results.title: If these walls could talk
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Nancy Savoca and Cher
results.brief_description: Three short films made for television, centred around the theme of women and abortion, set over three decades with each story reflecting changing social conditions for women. “1952”: Claire (Demi Moore), a pregnant young war widow, is devastated by her lack of choices and unsympathetic views of her colleagues and family. After failing to induce a miscarriage Claire searches for an illegal abortionist, with dire consequences. “1974”: A mother of four’s unplanned pregnancy threatens her newly found emancipation at college. “1996”: University student Chris (Anne Heche) is pregnant to a professor who has no interest in her or the baby. Whilst Chris is deciding whether to keep the baby she is besieged by anti-abortionists at a clinic and faces being slighted by her moralising best friend. Chris becomes increasingly despondent as she tries to make a decision about her future. Although these three short films are melodramatic and fairly straightforward in both their presentation and dramatisation, the issues that they remark upon are compelling, particularly within the context of each decades shifting social mores and attitudes toward women’s issues.

results.title: If the fergi fits, wear it
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company, Dan Gomez and John Cosgrove
results.brief_description: Presents the story of the first business venture by a teenage brother and sister who decide to sell silk-screened T-shirts. Shows some of the responsibilities and advantages of going into business. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: If only we'd known
results.brief_description: A series of 3 “trigger” films designed to stimulate discussion, led by a discussion leader. Part 1 - “Debbie and Linda”, concerns a 16 year old schoolgirl who thinks she is pregnant, and turns to her friend Linda, who is expecting a baby. Following this, a doctor is seen interviewing another pregnant teenage girl. Part 2 - “Clinic Talk” - Deborah has just had her pregnancy confirmed - is paying her first visit to the ante-natal clinic. Now, as she waits for her boyfriend she meets Sarah, who is expecting her second child. Part 3 - “Sarah and Eric”. Sarah arrives home from the ante-natal clinic and tells her husband Eric that she has been told to take it easy. Eric persuades her to keep working, as they need the money, and adds that everything was all right when they had their first child.
